node.display_long_description:
OrbusVR: Reborn is the first MMORPG designed exclusively for room-scale virtual reality. 

It features everything you love about an MMO: a huge open world, hundreds of hours of content, story quests, dragon pets, five-player group dungeons, ten-player Raids, voice chat, player trading, and more! With a community that's been around since the very beginning of VR, and dozens of updates delivered by the developers, OrbusVR is one of the most content-rich games available in virtual reality today.

OrbusVR: Reborn features gorgeous hand-painted visuals, improved performance and stability, and a host of new features, including: 

• 4 NEW playable classes (8 total)
• Opt-in World PvP & Battlegrounds 
• Honor Ranks and Title System 
• NEW enemies, featuring improved monster AI 
• NEW activities, including airship adventures, pet dragon racing, public events and more 
• 100+ hours of content, including weekly missions 

Immerse yourself in a world of discovery. Join the OrbusVR community today.

nodes.title: Spring Festival is Now Live!
nodes.body_text:
Spring has returned to Patreayl again and with it the spring festival of Skogronn.Two familiar foes have also made their return: the Skogtrolls, who can be spotted near the tree shrines maintained in their honor, and the ravens, who are known to steal offerings from the shrines on their migration through Patreayl.

While some see the Skogtrolls as benevolent spirits vital to the recovery of Patreayl's natural resources, others see them as murderous, malevolent spirits. Visit the Festival NPC outside the gates of Highsteppe to pick up the first quest and decide for yourself!



This year’s rewards include:

- Spring Festival 2021 Cape
- Shrine Mount
- Flower Transmog Helm and Shoulder Set



Dragon Breeding Update: New Colors

Today’s patch also includes 3 new color additions to the dragon breeding pool:  Hot Pink, Yellow, and Taupe. With this addition, there are now a total of 13 colors available for dragon breeding—which means there are more than 2,000 different color combinations possible. From this patch forward, all new dragons bred will also have the name of the breeder saved inside the tooltip data that pops up when hovering over the item.

New Community Event Area

Today’s patch will also include a new space for the community to hold events without performance issues associated with large-scale events in the overworld. It is called Edge of Nowhere and can be accessed through a door inside the Highsteppe Tavern next to the Long-Term Mission vendor.

It is a 1 SQ KM, sparsely decorated area with no monsters or other game play elements to keep performance as high as possible. We are hoping that this will be a good area for the larger community events that have been taking place in the overworld!

nodes.title: Last Call for Winter Festival of Strangers Quests
nodes.body_text:
Spring festival will launch Tuesday, March 2nd, which means you only have a couple weeks left to finish the winter Festival of Strangers mission and questlines. As a reminder, if you still need to pick up all the relevant mission and quests, you will need to visit:

- Festival NPC outside the gates of Highsteppe - main Heart of the Strangers questline
- Festival Farmer outside the Critter Capture shop - Floating lights side quest
- Pierre Cenn inside the Critter Capture shop - Snowman Critter Capture mission

This year’s rewards include:

- Snowman Transmog set
- Fireplace (Player House furniture)
- Snowshoes mount
- Festival of Strangers 2020 cape
- 2020 Snowman pet

And if you haven’t started or finished the Anniversary Scavenger Hunt, chat with the Anniversary NPC next to the bulletin board near the Player House to start that questline. Complete the scavenger hunt to win a fun Penguin transmog, perfect for blending in the remaining couple weeks of winter in-game.

node.reviewDescription:
This is the first and only available vr mmorpg right now, which makes it a must buy product.
Unfortunately this is all about pros.

Cons:
- The graphics is not good but still suitable.
- Not newbies friendly.
- Strange mechanics. Like every class has his own mini game to perform during the battle. Some of it even looks interesting, but exists in a stupid way. Like a mage here has to memorize and draw runes in the air which is challenging since it needs to be done without any mistake. It would be fun if after all the hard drawing you cast something really powerful that insta kills a mob or does a lot of area damage. But instead you do just regular dps and have to spam a "B" sign like an idiot. Which in the end of the day just makes you pick a Scoundrel (a class with a handgun) and do no brain spamming of shots.
- Lack of diversity. As I said there is no regular classes here since the mechanics are pretty strange and annoying. The problem could be solved by adding a system of talents or specs. So you would have this rune mage, but also some classic fire or ice mage and can choose your own play style. Still there is no such system in a game.

The conclusion:
This is the first game of it's kind and would be a must buy and must play as long as there are no competitors nearby. But I'm afraid the first alternative that comes to the market (for example Ilysia) will kill it. Cause people want classic wow like game style and user friendly experience.

As for me, I enjoy it since there are no alternatives.

It features everything you love about an MMO: a huge open world, hundreds of hours of quests, dragon pets, five-player group dungeons, ten-player Raids, voice chat, player trading, and more!
